intro: Acroblastum spicatum, commonly known as the spiky acroblast, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features narrow, spiny leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acroblastum spicatum is considered a species of conservation concern.
